data.title: Harrisburg Area YMCA
data.meta_description: Jeffrey AllenSenior VP of OperationsHarrisburg Area YMCA(717) 346-1631
data.text:
Jeff currently serves as the Senior VP of Operations for the Harrisburg Area YMCA and the Executive Director of the West Shore YMCA. In his role as Senior VP of Operations, he is responsible for the day-to-day operations and oversight of Branch Operations, Executive Directors, and Site Directors at each of the five Branch YMCA sites serving communities throughout the Harrisburg area. As Executive Director of the West Shore YMCA, he is responsible for the supervision and daily operations of the full facility West Shore Branch located in Camp Hill and various off-site programs.

Jeff has served as a YMCA professional for over 33 years. He previously served as the Executive Director and Associate Executive Director for the East Shore Branch YMCA. He also held the Senior Program and Aquatic Director Positions at the Hanover Area Family YMCA. Jeff started his YMCA career at the Butler and Sewickley YMCAs in Western Pennsylvania.

Jeff resides in Mechanicsburg with his wife Leesa and two adult sons. His hobbies include outdoor activities (fishing, hunting, walking, swimming, etc), antique cars, and spending time with family. “I love the YMCA because I believe in the YMCA Mission and Values. I also enjoy the people that I get to meet and work with every day!”

Chelstan joined the Harrisburg Area YMCA in 2007 as a Fitness Director at the Northern Dauphin County Branch where he served in several professional capacities during his tenure. During this time, Chelstan oversaw a variety of programs and initiatives including Active Older Adults, Youth & Government, Mentoring, Risk Management, and Fundraising. In 2017, Chelstan was appointed the Executive Director of the Northern Dauphin County YMCA following a year-long role as Acting Executive. As Executive, Chelstan led the branch through the COVID-19 pandemic, overseeing community collaborations to meet local needs. Notably, Chelstan’s leadership of the Healthy Corner Store Initiative and the USDA Food Program Grant led to the distribution of hundreds of meals and a healthy food increase to children and families in the community.

Since January 2023, Chelstan has taken a new role advancing his responsibilities with the Harrisburg Area YMCA as the East Shore YMCA Branch YMCA Executive Director. As of January, Chelstan continues to increase programming at the branch as well as memberships and community development.

Chelstan resides in Halifax with his wife Alicia and two sons, Chel and Titan. His hobbies are hunting, fishing, boating, working out, coaching his children in youth sports, and spending time with his family. The YMCA has been a big contributor to Chelstan’s life since graduating from Lock Haven University in 2007 where he was a two-sport athlete in foot and track & field as a running back/sprinter.

Grace began her career with the YMCA at the YMCA of San Francisco in grant writing, securing over $1.2 million in grants during her final fiscal year in that position. She was promoted to the Director of Financial Development position, raising an impressive number of unrestricted gifts, and managing events that netted over $100,000 in annual support. She was also responsible for the oversight of over $5 million in government grants at that time.

Most recently, Grace has worked at the YMCA of Honolulu as their Director of Philanthropy, raising more than $1.33 million in unrestricted funds annually, and more than $6 million in government and private grants. Grace holds her Masters in Public Administration from George Washington University and her Bachelors in History from the University of San Francisco.

Tish recently joined the Harrisburg Area YMCA in 2023 as the Site Director for the Camp Curtin location. Her goal is to develop new programming for the youth, make holistic wellness a priority, and provide resources for community involvement. Tish’s Y journey started in 2008, working for the YMCA in Greater Pittsburgh. Her various responsibilities and positions included: being a Member Services Representative, teaching Group Exercise classes, and developing the Personal Training program. Throughout her 7-year tenure with the Y, Tish became the Healthy Living Director overseeing Fitness initiatives, connecting with community partners, and advocating for youth involvement in various activities. Tish also developed collaborative partnerships with the Special Olympics organization to accommodate clients with disabilities.

Tish enjoys spending time with her wife and 3 kids, visiting her grandmother and adopted cousin Pittsburgh, and rough playing with the dogs. Tish loves the YMCA organization for giving her the opportunity to be a leader, create lasting friendships, and the continuation of helping various communities.

Amy started with the Harrisburg Area YMCA Center for Healthy Living in February 2018. She was previously the Associate Executive Director. Amy oversees the Evidence-Based Health Intervention (EBHI) programs that the center and staff team facilitate within the Central PA communities. Additionally, the Center for Healthy Living team travels statewide to provide resources to Pennsylvanians through other initiatives related to healthcare access, and insurance coverage through Pennie®.

Amy serves Pennsylvania as a Certified Community Health Worker, she sits on various committees and boards regarding the overall health and well-being of Pennsylvanians. Before being employed with the YMCA, she was a social worker within Dauphin County, focusing on the mental health and criminal justice systems. She attended Pennsylvania State University where she earned her bachelor of science in Sociology and Criminology. Amy is always excited to connect with new individuals and continue her work in helping community members throughout the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and beyond.

Chad is the Executive Director of the Friendship YMCA located in Lower Paxton Township. He started working for the Harrisburg Area YMCA in 1997 as a Personal Trainer. Chad moved into a Program Director position in the early 2000s and eventually directed the Race Series and worked with the Men’s Residence Program. In 2011, Chad became Executive Director at the East Shore YMCA which led to his transition to the Friendship Branch that opened in 2021.

The YMCA has always been a family affair for the Krebs Crew. Chad met his wife Stephanie at the Y and raised their kids at the YMCA as his career developed. The Krebs family has served the residents of East Shore many meals and has worked, volunteered, and participated in most of the race events that the Y has hosted over the years. Serving the community through the YMCA mission in so many ways has been the driving force that keeps Chad going throughout his career as a Y Director. Working with people and helping them take steps toward a better life no matter how big or small is the most rewarding work of any YMCA staff member.

Megan started her Y career in 2015 as the Wellness Director at the Northern Dauphin County YMCA. She then served as the Senior Program Director with the YMCA Center for Healthy Living where she oversaw the implementation of the Y’s evidence-based health intervention programs, as well as worked to bridge the gap between community and clinical partners. Megan loves the Y because she sees it as an integral part of our community in helping others reach their goals and improve their quality of life. When she isn’t at the Y, Megan enjoys spending time outdoors with her husband, Seth, and daughters, Brielle and Willow.

David has served in the YMCA for over 30 years. He began his Y journey in Raleigh, NC as the Youth Sports Director at the A.E. Finley YMCA. David has served in 6 different capacities, including serving as the President/CEO of the YMCA of Greater New Orleans and the YMCA of Greater High Point. He met his wife, Page at the YMCA in Kings Mountain, NC and each of his three girls has been raised in the YMCA either as campers/participants or now as employees of the YMCA. “The joy that I receive from watching kids and adults grow and achieve their goals is why I have stayed with the Y. Fostering the community of support within our facilities and programs gives me purpose and meaning. This has been a remarkably rewarding career!”

Eric began his Y career shortly after graduating from Lock Haven University. Eric served as an intern at the YMCA of the Rockies before moving back to his hometown and diving into his professional career with the Harrisburg Area YMCA. Eric started as a Youth Program Coordinator with the Northern Dauphin County Branch YMCA before discovering his passion for prevention programs and YMCA advocation.

Eric has worked with the PA State Alliance of YMCAs, serving on their Government Action Committee and enhancing the relationships that the Y has with local, county, state, and federal government officials. Another dream came true for Eric when he was given the opportunity to serve as the Vice President of Government Relations for the Harrisburg Area YMCA, where he hopes to continue tenaciously advocating for youth and overall community wellness across the state.

Jason started his Y journey back in 2004 as the Fitness Director at the West Shore Branch of the Harrisburg Area YMCA. Over the years, his role has increased to marketing responsibilities for the branch in 2009 and then overseeing the Youth & Sports department in 2015. When the Y started offering chronic disease prevention programs in 2016, Jason led the pilot LIVESTRONG® at the YMCA program as well as the YMCA’s Diabetes Prevention Program.

Jason has helped the Y grow through facility expansion and endure through tough times in the COVID-19 pandemic. Something that has remained constant is the Y mission and the great people Jason met along the way. Jason looks forward to his next journey in continuing the growth of the West Shore Branch and strengthening our community in the greater Harrisburg area.

Rosie joined the YMCA in 2012 as the first Director of Marketing and Communications in the Association’s history. Over the course of her work at the YMCA, she has worked closely with every department and branch to help infuse the brand of the YMCA into the culture of our Association. Rosie has been recognized by the YMCA of the USA for excellence in website design and has been called on to speak about brand implementation by the state and national YMCA marketing staff, local industry groups, and college programs. Her work at the YMCA has focused on both functionality and design, creating a high visual and cultural standard for our YMCA.

As our YMCA has grown, Rosie’s role at the Association has evolved into developing how our YMCA relates to stakeholders, staff, and the community in ways that go beyond traditional marketing and communications duties. As Vice President of Experience, she now directs the overall brand experience that our YMCA creates and oversees the membership and childcare teams to refine processes, structure training, and encourage a culture that reflects the YMCA’s mission in all areas. She lives in Hummelstown with her husband Ian and daughter, Quinn.
